generation

Class MazeFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • generation.MazeFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Factory

    public class MazeFactory
extends java.lang.Object
implements Factory
    This class encapsulates how a maze is generated. It takes orders to produce a maze, delegates it to the matching maze builder that computes and delivers the maze. This class operates the worker thread to do the computation in the background. The maze builder classes contribute a run method to execute on the worker thread.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MazeFactory()
      Constructor for a randomized maze generation
      MazeFactory(boolean deterministic)
      Constructor with option to make maze generation deterministic or random

    • Method Detail

      • order

        public boolean order(Order order)
        Description copied from interface: Factory
        Takes or rejects an order. The method returns immediately and signals if the order is accepted or not. The actual production is performed in a background thread and delivery of the ordered MazeConfiguration takes place by calling the deliver method of the given order object.
        Specified by:
        order in interface Factory
        Returns:
        true if order is accepted, false if refused

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
        Description copied from interface: Factory
        Cancels the current order if there is any that is not not completed yet.
        Specified by:
        cancel in interface Factory

      • waitTillDelivered

        public void waitTillDelivered()
        Description copied from interface: Factory
        Wait till order is fulfilled. This method returns after the produced maze has been delivered. This method can be used to have a more synchronous behavior which is helpful for testing for example.
        Specified by:
        waitTillDelivered in interface Factory
